045/**
046 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link BeanContext}.
047 *
048 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
049 *    <li class='info'>Typically session objects are not thread safe nor reusable.  However, bean sessions do not maintain any state and
050 *       thus can be safely cached and reused.
051 * </ul>
052 *
053 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
054
055 * </ul>
056 */
057@SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
058public class BeanSession extends ContextSession {
059
060   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
061   // Static
062   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
063
064   private static Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(BeanSession.class.getName());
065
066   /**
067    * Creates a builder of this object.
068    *
069    * @param ctx The context creating this builder.
070    * @return A new builder.
071    */
072   public static Builder create(BeanContext ctx) {
073      return new Builder(ctx);
074   }
075
076   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
077   // Builder
078   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
079
080   /**
081    * Builder class.
082    */
083   @FluentSetters
084   public static class Builder extends ContextSession.Builder {
085
086      BeanContext ctx;
087      TimeZone timeZone;
088      Locale locale;
089      MediaType mediaType;
090
091      /**
092       * Constructor
093       *
094       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
095       */
096      protected Builder(BeanContext ctx) {
097         super(ctx);
098         this.ctx = ctx;
099         timeZone = ctx.timeZone;
100         locale = ctx.locale;
101         mediaType = ctx.mediaType;
102      }
103
104      /**
105       * Build the object.
106       *
107       * @return The built object.
108       */
109      @Override
110      public BeanSession build() {
111         return new BeanSession(this);
112      }
113
114      /**
115       * The session locale.
116       *
117       * <p>
118       * Specifies the default locale for serializer and parser sessions.
119       *
120       * <p>
121       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)}.
122       *
123       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
124       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#locale()}
125       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)}
126       * </ul>
127       *
128       * @param value
129       *    The new value for this property.
130       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
131       * @return This object.
132       */
133      @FluentSetter
134      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
135         if (value != null)
136            locale = value;
137         return this;
138      }
139
140      /**
141       * Same as {@link #locale(Locale)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
142       *
143       * @param value
144       *    The new value for this property.
145       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
146       * @return This object.
147       */
148      @FluentSetter
149      public Builder localeDefault(Locale value) {
150         if (value != null && locale == null)
151            locale = value;
152         return this;
153      }
154
155      /**
156       * The session media type.
157       *
158       * <p>
159       * Specifies the default media type value for serializer and parser sessions.
160       *
161       * <p>
162       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}.
163       *
164       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
165       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#mediaType()}
166       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)}
167       * </ul>
168       *
169       * @param value
170       *    The new value for this property.
171       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
172       * @return This object.
173       */
174      @FluentSetter
175      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
176         if (value != null)
177            mediaType = value;
178         return this;
179      }
180
181      /**
182       * Same as {@link #mediaType(MediaType)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
183       *
184       * @param value
185       *    The new value for this property.
186       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
187       * @return This object.
188       */
189      @FluentSetter
190      public Builder mediaTypeDefault(MediaType value) {
191         if (value != null && mediaType == null)
192            mediaType = value;
193         return this;
194      }
195
196      /**
197       * The session timezone.
198       *
199       * <p>
200       * Specifies the default timezone for serializer and parser sessions.
201       *
202       * <p>
203       * If not specified, defaults to {@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}.
204       *
205       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
206       *    <li class='ja'>{@link BeanConfig#timeZone()}
207       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)}
208       * </ul>
209       *
210       * @param value
211       *    The new value for this property.
212       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
213       * @return This object.
214       */
215      @FluentSetter
216      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
217         if (value != null)
218            timeZone = value;
219         return this;
220      }
221
222      /**
223       * Same as {@link #timeZone(TimeZone)} but doesn't overwrite the value if it is already set.
224       *
225       * @param value
226       *    The new value for this property.
227       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then the locale defined on the context is used.
228       * @return This object.
229       */
230      @FluentSetter
231      public Builder timeZoneDefault(TimeZone value) {
232         if (value != null && timeZone == null)
233            timeZone = value;
234         return this;
235      }
236
237      // <FluentSetters>
238
239      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
240      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
241         super.apply(type, apply);
242         return this;
243      }
244
245      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
246      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
247         super.debug(value);
248         return this;
249      }
250
251      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
252      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
253         super.properties(value);
254         return this;
255      }
256
257      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
258      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
259         super.property(key, value);
260         return this;
261      }
262
263      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
264      public Builder unmodifiable() {
265         super.unmodifiable();
266         return this;
267      }
268
269      // </FluentSetters>
270   }
271
272   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
273   // Instance
274   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
275
276   private final BeanContext ctx;
277   private final Locale locale;
278   private final TimeZone timeZone;
279   private final MediaType mediaType;
280
281   /**
282    * Constructor.
283    *
284    * @param builder The builder for this object.
285    */
286   protected BeanSession(Builder builder) {
287      super(builder);
288      ctx = builder.ctx;
289      locale = builder.locale;
290      timeZone = builder.timeZone;
291      mediaType = builder.mediaType;
292   }
293
294   /**
295    * Converts the specified value to the specified class type.
296    *
297    * <p>
298    * See {@link #convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)} for the list of valid conversions.
299    *
300    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
301    * @param value The value to convert.
302    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
303    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
304    * @return The converted value.
305    */
306   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
307      // Shortcut for most common case.
308      if (value != null && value.getClass() == type)
309         return (T)value;
310      return convertToMemberType(null, value, getClassMeta(type));
311   }
312
313   /**
314    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
315    * be instantiated within another class instance.
316    *
317    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
318    * @param outer
319    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
320    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
321    * @param value The value to convert.
322    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
323    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
324    * @return The converted value.
325    */
326   public final <T> T convertToMemberType(Object outer, Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
327      return convertToMemberType(outer, value, getClassMeta(type));
328   }
329
330   /**
331    * Casts the specified value into the specified type.
332    *
333    * <p>
334    * If the value isn't an instance of the specified type, then converts the value if possible.
335    *
336    * <p>
337    * The following conversions are valid:
338    * <table class='styled'>
339    *    <tr><th>Convert to type</th><th>Valid input value types</th><th>Notes</th></tr>
340    *    <tr>
341    *       <td>
342    *          A class that is the normal type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
343    *       </td>
344    *       <td>
345    *          A value whose class matches the transformed type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
346    *       </td>
347    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
348    *    </tr>
349    *    <tr>
350    *       <td>
351    *          A class that is the transformed type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
352    *       </td>
353    *       <td>
354    *          A value whose class matches the normal type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
355    *       </td>
356    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
357    *    </tr>
358    *    <tr>
359    *       <td>
360    *          {@code Number} (e.g. {@code Integer}, {@code Short}, {@code Float},...)
361    *          <br><code>Number.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code> (e.g. <code>Integer.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,
362    *          <code>Short.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>, <code>Float.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,...)
363    *       </td>
364    *       <td>
365    *          {@code Number}, {@code String}, <jk>null</jk>
366    *       </td>
367    *       <td>
368    *          For primitive {@code TYPES}, <jk>null</jk> returns the JVM default value for that type.
369    *       </td>
370    *    </tr>
371    *    <tr>
372    *       <td>
373    *          {@code Map} (e.g. {@code Map}, {@code HashMap}, {@code TreeMap}, {@code JsonMap})
374    *       </td>
375    *       <td>
376    *          {@code Map}
377    *       </td>
378    *       <td>
379    *          If {@code Map} is not constructible, an {@code JsonMap} is created.
380    *       </td>
381    *    </tr>
382    *    <tr>
383    *       <td>
384    *       {@code Collection} (e.g. {@code List}, {@code LinkedList}, {@code HashSet}, {@code JsonList})
385    *       </td>
386    *       <td>
387    *          {@code Collection<Object>}
388    *          <br>{@code Object[]}
389    *       </td>
390    *       <td>
391    *          If {@code Collection} is not constructible, an {@code JsonList} is created.
392    *       </td>
393    *    </tr>
394    *    <tr>
395    *       <td>
396    *          {@code X[]} (array of any type X)
397    *       </td>
398    *       <td>
399    *          {@code List<X>}
400    *       </td>
401    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
402    *    </tr>
403    *    <tr>
404    *       <td>
405    *          {@code X[][]} (multi-dimensional arrays)
406    *       </td>
407    *       <td>
408    *          {@code List<List<X>>}
409    *          <br>{@code List<X[]>}
410    *          <br>{@code List[]<X>}
411    *       </td>
412    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
413    *    </tr>
414    *    <tr>
415    *       <td>
416    *          {@code Enum}
417    *       </td>
418    *       <td>
419    *          {@code String}
420    *       </td>
421    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
422    *    </tr>
423    *    <tr>
424    *       <td>
425    *          Bean
426    *       </td>
427    *       <td>
428    *          {@code Map}
429    *       </td>
430    *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
431    *    </tr>
432    *    <tr>
433    *       <td>
434    *          {@code String}
435    *       </td>
436    *       <td>
437    *          Anything
438    *       </td>
439    *       <td>
440    *          Arrays are converted to JSON arrays
441    *       </td>
442    *    </tr>
443    *    <tr>
444    *       <td>
445    *          Anything with one of the following methods:
446    *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T fromString(String)</code>
447    *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T valueOf(String)</code>
448    *          <br><code><jk>public</jk> T(String)</code>
449    *       </td>
450    *       <td>
451    *          <c>String</c>
452    *       </td>
453    *       <td>
454    *          <br>
455    *       </td>
456    *    </tr>
457    * </table>
458    *
459    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
460    * @param value The value to be converted.
461    * @param type The target object type.
462    * @return The converted type.
463    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
464    */
465   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, ClassMeta<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
466      return convertToMemberType(null, value, type);
467   }
468
469   /**
470    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, but allows for complex data types consisting of collections or maps.
471    *
472    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
473    * @param value The value to be converted.
474    * @param type The target object type.
475    * @param args The target object parameter types.
476    * @return The converted type.
477    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
478    */
479   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Type type, Type...args) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
480      return (T)convertToMemberType(null, value, getClassMeta(type, args));
481   }
482
483   /**
484    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, ClassMeta)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
485    * be instantiated within another class instance.
486    *
487    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
488    * @param outer
489    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
490    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
491    * @param value The value to convert.
492    * @param to The class type to convert the value to.
493    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
494    * @return The converted value.
495    */
496   protected final <T> T convertToMemberType(Object outer, Object value, ClassMeta<T> to) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
497      if (to == null)
498         to = (ClassMeta<T>)object();
499
500      try {
501         // Handle the case of a null value.
502         if (value == null) {
503
504            // If it's a primitive, then use the converters to get the default value for the primitive type.
505            if (to.isPrimitive())
506               return to.getPrimitiveDefault();
507
508            // Otherwise, just return null.
509            return to.isOptional() ? (T)to.getOptionalDefault() : null;
510         }
511
512         if (to.isOptional() && (! (value instanceof Optional)))
513            return (T) Utils.opt(convertToMemberType(outer, value, to.getElementType()));
514
515         Class<T> tc = to.getInnerClass();
516
517         // If no conversion needed, then just return the value.
518         // Don't include maps or collections, because child elements may need conversion.
519         if (tc.isInstance(value))
520            if (! ((to.isMap() && to.getValueType().isNotObject()) || ((to.isCollection() || to.isOptional()) && to.getElementType().isNotObject())))
521               return (T)value;
522
523         ObjectSwap swap = to.getSwap(this);
524         if (swap != null) {
525            ClassInfo nc = swap.getNormalClass(), fc = swap.getSwapClass();
526            if (nc.isParentOf(tc) && fc.isParentOf(value.getClass()))
527               return (T)swap.unswap(this, value, to);
528            ClassMeta fcm = getClassMeta(fc.inner());
529            if (fcm.isNumber() && value instanceof Number) {
530               value = convertToMemberType(null, value, fc.inner());
531               return (T)swap.unswap(this, value, to);
532            }
533         }
534
535         ClassMeta<?> from = getClassMetaForObject(value);
536         swap = from.getSwap(this);
537         if (swap != null) {
538            ClassInfo nc = swap.getNormalClass(), fc = swap.getSwapClass();
539            if (nc.isParentOf(from.getInnerClass()) && fc.isParentOf(tc))
540               return (T)swap.swap(this, value);
541         }
542
543         if (to.isPrimitive()) {
544            if (to.isNumber()) {
545               if (from.isNumber()) {
546                  Number n = (Number)value;
547                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
548                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(n.intValue());
549                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
550                     return (T)Short.valueOf(n.shortValue());
551                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
552                     return (T)Long.valueOf(n.longValue());
553                  if (tc == Float.TYPE)
554                     return (T)Float.valueOf(n.floatValue());
555                  if (tc == Double.TYPE)
556                     return (T)Double.valueOf(n.doubleValue());
557                  if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
558                     return (T)Byte.valueOf(n.byteValue());
559               } else if (from.isBoolean()) {
560                  Boolean b = (Boolean)value;
561                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
562                     return (T)(Integer.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0));
563                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
564                     return (T)(Short.valueOf(b ? (short)1 : 0));
565                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
566                     return (T)(Long.valueOf(b ? 1L : 0));
567                  if (tc == Float.TYPE)
568                     return (T)(Float.valueOf(b ? 1f : 0));
569                  if (tc == Double.TYPE)
570                     return (T)(Double.valueOf(b ? 1d : 0));
571                  if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
572                     return (T)(Byte.valueOf(b ? (byte)1 : 0));
573               } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
574                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
575               } else {
576                  String s = value.toString();
577                  int multiplier = (tc == Integer.TYPE || tc == Short.TYPE || tc == Long.TYPE) ? getMultiplier(s) : 1;
578                  if (multiplier != 1) {
579                     s = s.substring(0, s.length()-1).trim();
580                     Long l = Long.valueOf(s) * multiplier;
581                     if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
582                        return (T)Integer.valueOf(l.intValue());
583                     if (tc == Short.TYPE)
584                        return (T)Short.valueOf(l.shortValue());
585                     if (tc == Long.TYPE)
586                        return (T)l;
587                  } else {
588                     if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
589                        return (T)Integer.valueOf(s);
590                     if (tc == Short.TYPE)
591                        return (T)Short.valueOf(s);
592                     if (tc == Long.TYPE)
593                        return (T)Long.valueOf(s);
594                     if (tc == Float.TYPE)
595                        return (T)Float.valueOf(s);
596                     if (tc == Double.TYPE)
597                        return (T)Double.valueOf(s);
598                     if (tc == Byte.TYPE)
599                        return (T)Byte.valueOf(s);
600                  }
601               }
602            } else if (to.isChar()) {
603               if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
604                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
605               return (T)parseCharacter(value);
606            } else if (to.isBoolean()) {
607               if (from.isNumber()) {
608                  int i = ((Number)value).intValue();
609                  return (T)(i == 0 ? Boolean.FALSE : Boolean.TRUE);
610               } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
611                  return (T)to.info.getPrimitiveDefault();
612               } else {
613                  return (T)Boolean.valueOf(value.toString());
614               }
615            }
616         }
617
618         if (to.isNumber()) {
619            if (from.isNumber()) {
620               Number n = (Number)value;
621               if (tc == Integer.class)
622                  return (T)Integer.valueOf(n.intValue());
623               if (tc == Short.class)
624                  return (T)Short.valueOf(n.shortValue());
625               if (tc == Long.class)
626                  return (T)Long.valueOf(n.longValue());
627               if (tc == Float.class)
628                  return (T)Float.valueOf(n.floatValue());
629               if (tc == Double.class)
630                  return (T)Double.valueOf(n.doubleValue());
631               if (tc == Byte.class)
632                  return (T)Byte.valueOf(n.byteValue());
633               if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
634                  return (T)new AtomicInteger(n.intValue());
635               if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
636                  return (T)new AtomicLong(n.intValue());
637            } else if (from.isBoolean()) {
638               Boolean b = (Boolean)value;
639               if (tc == Integer.class)
640                  return (T)Integer.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
641               if (tc == Short.class)
642                  return (T)Short.valueOf(b ? (short)1 : 0);
643               if (tc == Long.class)
644                  return (T)Long.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
645               if (tc == Float.class)
646                  return (T)Float.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
647               if (tc == Double.class)
648                  return (T)Double.valueOf(b ? 1 : 0);
649               if (tc == Byte.class)
650                  return (T)Byte.valueOf(b ? (byte)1 : 0);
651               if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
652                  return (T)new AtomicInteger(b ? 1 : 0);
653               if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
654                  return (T)new AtomicLong(b ? 1 : 0);
655            } else if (isNullOrEmpty(value)) {
656               return null;
657            } else if (! hasMutater(from, to)) {
658               String s = value.toString();
659
660               int multiplier = (tc == Integer.class || tc == Short.class || tc == Long.class) ? getMultiplier(s) : 1;
661               if (multiplier != 1) {
662                  s = s.substring(0, s.length()-1).trim();
663                  Long l = Long.valueOf(s) * multiplier;
664                  if (tc == Integer.TYPE)
665                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(l.intValue());
666                  if (tc == Short.TYPE)
667                     return (T)Short.valueOf(l.shortValue());
668                  if (tc == Long.TYPE)
669                     return (T)Long.valueOf(l.longValue());
670               } else {
671                  if (tc == Integer.class)
672                     return (T)Integer.valueOf(s);
673                  if (tc == Short.class)
674                     return (T)Short.valueOf(s);
675                  if (tc == Long.class)
676                     return (T)Long.valueOf(s);
677                  if (tc == Float.class)
678                     return (T)Float.valueOf(s);
679                  if (tc == Double.class)
680                     return (T)Double.valueOf(s);
681                  if (tc == Byte.class)
682                     return (T)Byte.valueOf(s);
683                  if (tc == AtomicInteger.class)
684                     return (T)new AtomicInteger(Integer.valueOf(s));
685                  if (tc == AtomicLong.class)
686                     return (T)new AtomicLong(Long.valueOf(s));
687                  if (tc == Number.class)
688                     return (T)StringUtils.parseNumber(s, Number.class);
689               }
690            }
691         }
692
693         if (to.isChar()) {
694            if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
695               return null;
696            String s = value.toString();
697            if (s.length() == 1)
698               return (T)Character.valueOf(s.charAt(0));
699         }
700
701         if (to.isByteArray()) {
702            if (from.isInputStream())
703               return (T)readBytes((InputStream)value);
704            if (from.isReader())
705               return (T)read((Reader)value).getBytes();
706            if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
707               return to.mutateFrom(value);
708            if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
709               return from.mutateTo(value, to);
710            return (T) value.toString().getBytes(Charset.forName("UTF-8"));
711         }
712
713         // Handle setting of array properties
714         if (to.isArray()) {
715            if (from.isCollection())
716               return (T)toArray(to, (Collection)value);
717            else if (from.isArray())
718               return (T)toArray(to, alist((Object[])value));
719            else if (startsWith(value.toString(), '['))
720               return (T)toArray(to, JsonList.ofJson(value.toString()).setBeanSession(this));
721            else if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
722               return to.mutateFrom(value);
723            else if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
724               return from.mutateTo(value, to);
725            else
726               return (T)toArray(to, new JsonList((Object[])splita(value.toString())).setBeanSession(this));
727         }
728
729         // Target type is some sort of Map that needs to be converted.
730         if (to.isMap()) {
731            try {
732               if (from.isMap()) {
733                  Map m = to.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)to.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(to);
734                  ClassMeta keyType = to.getKeyType(), valueType = to.getValueType();
735                  ((Map<?,?>)value).forEach((k,v) -> {
736                     Object k2 = k;
737                     if (keyType.isNotObject()) {
738                        if (keyType.isString() && k.getClass() != Class.class)
739                           k2 = k.toString();
740                        else
741                           k2 = convertToMemberType(m, k, keyType);
742                     }
743                     Object v2 = v;
744                     if (valueType.isNotObject())
745                        v2 = convertToMemberType(m, v, valueType);
746                     m.put(k2, v2);
747                  });
748                  return (T)m;
749               } else if (!to.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer)) {
750                  JsonMap m = JsonMap.ofJson(value.toString());
751                  m.setBeanSession(this);
752                  return convertToMemberType(outer, m, to);
753               }
754            } catch (Exception e) {
755               throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, e);
756            }
757         }
758
759         // Target type is some sort of Collection
760         if (to.isCollection()) {
761            try {
762               Collection l = to.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Collection)to.newInstance(outer) : to.isSet() ? Utils.set() : new JsonList(this);
763               ClassMeta elementType = to.getElementType();
764
765               if (from.isArray()) {
766                  for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++) {
767                     Object o = Array.get(value, i);
768                     l.add(elementType.isObject() ? o : convertToMemberType(l, o, elementType));
769                  }
770               }
771               else if (from.isCollection())
772                  ((Collection)value).forEach(x -> l.add(elementType.isObject() ? x : convertToMemberType(l, x, elementType)));
773               else if (from.isMap())
774                  l.add(elementType.isObject() ? value : convertToMemberType(l, value, elementType));
775               else if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
776                  return null;
777               else if (from.isString()) {
778                  String s = value.toString();
779                  if (isJsonArray(s, false)) {
780                     JsonList l2 = JsonList.ofJson(s);
781                     l2.setBeanSession(this);
782                     l2.forEach(x -> l.add(elementType.isObject() ? x : convertToMemberType(l, x, elementType)));
783                  } else {
784                     throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, null);
785                  }
786               }
787               else
788                  throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, null);
789               return (T)l;
790            } catch (InvalidDataConversionException e) {
791               throw e;
792            } catch (Exception e) {
793               throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value.getClass(), to, e);
794            }
795         }
796
797         if (to.isEnum()) {
798            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
799         }
800
801         if (to.isString()) {
802            if (from.isByteArray()) {
803               return (T) new String((byte[])value);
804            } else if (from.isMapOrBean() || from.isCollectionOrArrayOrOptional()) {
805               WriterSerializer ws = ctx.getBeanToStringSerializer();
806               if (ws != null)
807                  return (T)ws.serialize(value);
808            } else if (from.isClass()) {
809               return (T)((Class<?>)value).getName();
810            }
811            return (T)value.toString();
812         }
813
814         if (to.isCharSequence()) {
815            Class<?> c = value.getClass();
816            if (c.isArray()) {
817               if (c.getComponentType().isPrimitive()) {
818                  JsonList l = new JsonList(this);
819                  int size = Array.getLength(value);
820                  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
821                     l.add(Array.get(value, i));
822                  value = l;
823               }
824               value = new JsonList((Object[])value).setBeanSession(this);
825            }
826
827            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
828         }
829
830         if (to.isBoolean()) {
831            if (from.isNumber())
832               return (T)(Boolean.valueOf(((Number)value).intValue() != 0));
833            if (isNullOrEmpty(value))
834               return null;
835            if (! hasMutater(from, to))
836               return (T)Boolean.valueOf(value.toString());
837         }
838
839         // It's a bean being initialized with a Map
840         if (to.isBean() && value instanceof Map) {
841            BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)to.getBuilderSwap(this);
842
843            if (value instanceof JsonMap && builder == null) {
844               JsonMap m2 = (JsonMap)value;
845               String typeName = m2.getString(getBeanTypePropertyName(to));
846               if (typeName != null) {
847                  ClassMeta cm = to.getBeanRegistry().getClassMeta(typeName);
848                  if (cm != null && to.info.isParentOf(cm.innerClass))
849                     return (T)m2.cast(cm);
850               }
851            }
852            if (builder != null) {
853               BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, to));
854               m.load((Map<?,?>) value);
855               return builder.build(this, m.getBean(), to);
856            }
857            return newBeanMap(tc).load((Map<?,?>) value).getBean();
858         }
859
860         if (to.isInputStream()) {
861            if (from.isByteArray()) {
862               byte[] b = (byte[])value;
863               return (T) new ByteArrayInputStream(b, 0, b.length);
864            }
865            byte[] b = value.toString().getBytes();
866            return (T)new ByteArrayInputStream(b, 0, b.length);
867         }
868
869         if (to.isReader()) {
870            if (from.isByteArray()) {
871               byte[] b = (byte[])value;
872               return (T) new StringReader(new String(b));
873            }
874            return (T)new StringReader(value.toString());
875         }
876
877         if (to.isCalendar()) {
878            if (from.isCalendar()) {
879               Calendar c = (Calendar)value;
880               if (value instanceof GregorianCalendar) {
881                  GregorianCalendar c2 = new GregorianCalendar(c.getTimeZone());
882                  c2.setTime(c.getTime());
883                  return (T)c2;
884               }
885            }
886            if (from.isDate()) {
887               Date d = (Date)value;
888               if (value instanceof GregorianCalendar) {
889                  GregorianCalendar c2 = new GregorianCalendar(TimeZone.getDefault());
890                  c2.setTime(d);
891                  return (T)c2;
892               }
893            }
894            return (T)DatatypeConverter.parseDateTime(DateUtils.toValidISO8601DT(value.toString()));
895         }
896
897         if (to.isDate() && to.getInnerClass() == Date.class) {
898            if (from.isCalendar())
899               return (T)((Calendar)value).getTime();
900            return (T)DatatypeConverter.parseDateTime(DateUtils.toValidISO8601DT(value.toString())).getTime();
901         }
902
903         if (to.hasMutaterFrom(from))
904            return to.mutateFrom(value);
905
906         if (from.hasMutaterTo(to))
907            return from.mutateTo(value, to);
908
909         if (to.isBean())
910            return newBeanMap(to.getInnerClass()).load(value.toString()).getBean();
911
912         if (to.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer))
913            return to.newInstanceFromString(outer, value.toString());
914
915      } catch (Exception e) {
916         throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value, to, e);
917      }
918
919      throw new InvalidDataConversionException(value, to, null);
920   }
921
922   private static boolean hasMutater(ClassMeta<?> from, ClassMeta<?> to) {
923      return to.hasMutaterFrom(from) || from.hasMutaterTo(to);
924   }
925
926   private static final boolean isNullOrEmpty(Object o) {
927      return o == null || o.toString().isEmpty() || o.toString().equals("null");
928   }
929
930   private static int getMultiplier(String s) {
931      if (s.endsWith("G"))
932         return 1024*1024*1024;
933      if (s.endsWith("M"))
934         return 1024*1024;
935      if (s.endsWith("K"))
936         return 1024;
937      return 1;
938   }
939
940   /**
941    * Converts the contents of the specified list into an array.
942    *
943    * <p>
944    * Works on both object and primitive arrays.
945    *
946    * <p>
947    * In the case of multi-dimensional arrays, the incoming list must contain elements of type n-1 dimension.
948    * i.e. if {@code type} is <code><jk>int</jk>[][]</code> then {@code list} must have entries of type
949    * <code><jk>int</jk>[]</code>.
950    *
951    * @param type The type to convert to.  Must be an array type.
952    * @param list The contents to populate the array with.
953    * @return A new object or primitive array.
954    */
955   protected final Object toArray(ClassMeta<?> type, Collection<?> list) {
956      if (list == null)
957         return null;
958      ClassMeta<?> componentType = type.isArgs() ? object() : type.getElementType();
959      Object array = Array.newInstance(componentType.getInnerClass(), list.size());
960      IntValue i = IntValue.create();
961      list.forEach(x -> {
962         Object x2 = x;
963         if (! type.getInnerClass().isInstance(x)) {
964            if (componentType.isArray() && x instanceof Collection)
965               x2 = toArray(componentType, (Collection<?>)x);
966            else if (x == null && componentType.isPrimitive())
967               x2 = componentType.getPrimitiveDefault();
968            else
969               x2 = convertToType(x, componentType);
970         }
971         try {
972            Array.set(array, i.getAndIncrement(), x2);
973         } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
974            throw e;
975         }
976      });
977      return array;
978   }
979
980   /**
981    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}).
982    *
983    * <p>
984    * If object is not a true bean, then throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a
985    * bean.
986    *
987    * <p>
988    * If object is already a {@link BeanMap}, simply returns the same object.
989    *
990    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
991    * <p class='bjava'>
992    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map around a bean instance</jc>
993    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> Person());
994    * </p>
995    *
996    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
997    * @param o The object to wrap in a map interface.  Must not be null.
998    * @return The wrapped object.
999    */
1000   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o) {
1001      if (o instanceof BeanMap)
1002         return (BeanMap<T>)o;
1003      return this.toBeanMap(o, (Class<T>)o.getClass());
1004   }
1005
1006   /**
1007    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}).
1008    *
1009    * <p>
1010    * Same as {@link #toBeanMap(Object)} but allows you to specify a property namer instance.
1011    *
1012    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1013    * <p class='bjava'>
1014    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map around a bean instance</jc>
1015    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> Person(), PropertyNamerDLC.<jsf>INSTANCE</jsf>);
1016    * </p>
1017    *
1018    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1019    * @param o The object to wrap in a map interface.  Must not be null.
1020    * @param propertyNamer The property namer to use.
1021    * @return The wrapped object.
1022    */
1023   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o, PropertyNamer propertyNamer) {
1024      return this.toBeanMap(o, (Class<T>)o.getClass());
1025   }
1026
1027   /**
1028    * Determines whether the specified object matches the requirements on this context of being a bean.
1029    *
1030    * @param o The object being tested.
1031    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is considered a bean.
1032    */
1033   public final boolean isBean(Object o) {
1034      if (o == null)
1035         return false;
1036      return isBean(o.getClass());
1037   }
1038
1039   /**
1040    * Determines whether the specified class matches the requirements on this context of being a bean.
1041    *
1042    * @param c The class being tested.
1043    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class is considered a bean.
1044    */
1045   public final boolean isBean(Class<?> c) {
1046      return getBeanMeta(c) != null;
1047   }
1048
1049   /**
1050    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (i.e.: a modifiable {@link Map}) defined as a bean for one of its
1051    * class, a super class, or an implemented interface.
1052    *
1053    * <p>
1054    * If object is not a true bean, throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a bean.
1055    *
1056    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1057    * <p class='bjava'>
1058    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map for new bean using only properties defined in a superclass</jc>
1059    *    BeanMap&lt;MySubBean&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> MySubBean(), MySuperBean.<jk>class</jk>);
1060    *
1061    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map for new bean using only properties defined in an interface</jc>
1062    *    BeanMap&lt;MySubBean&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> MySubBean(), MySuperInterface.<jk>class</jk>);
1063    * </p>
1064    *
1065    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1066    * @param o The object to wrap in a bean interface.  Must not be null.
1067    * @param c The superclass to narrow the bean properties to.  Must not be null.
1068    * @return The bean representation, or <jk>null</jk> if the object is not a true bean.
1069    * @throws NullPointerException If either parameter is null.
1070    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the specified object is not an an instance of the specified class.
1071    * @throws
1072    *    BeanRuntimeException If specified object is not a bean according to the bean rules specified in this context
1073    * class.
1074    */
1075   public final <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T o, Class<? super T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1076      Utils.assertArgNotNull("o", o);
1077      Utils.assertArgNotNull("c", c);
1078      Utils.assertArg(c.isInstance(o), "The specified object is not an instance of the specified class.  class=''{0}'', objectClass=''{1}'', object=''{2}''", className(c), className(o), 0);
1079
1080      ClassMeta cm = getClassMeta(c);
1081
1082      BeanMeta m = cm.getBeanMeta();
1083      if (m == null)
1084         throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Class is not a bean.  Reason=''{0}''", cm.getNotABeanReason());
1085      return new BeanMap<>(this, o, m);
1086   }
1087
1088   /**
1089    * Creates a new {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}) of the given class with uninitialized
1090    * property values.
1091    *
1092    * <p>
1093    * If object is not a true bean, then throws a {@link BeanRuntimeException} with an explanation of why it's not a
1094    * bean.
1095    *
1096    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1097    * <p class='bjava'>
1098    *    <jc>// Construct a new bean map wrapped around a new Person object</jc>
1099    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.newBeanMap(Person.<jk>class</jk>);
1100    * </p>
1101    *
1102    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1103    * @param c The name of the class to create a new instance of.
1104    * @return A new instance of the class.
1105    */
1106   public final <T> BeanMap<T> newBeanMap(Class<T> c) {
1107      return newBeanMap(null, c);
1108   }
1109
1110   /**
1111    * Same as {@link #newBeanMap(Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must be instantiated
1112    * within another class instance.
1113    *
1114    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
1115    * @param c The name of the class to create a new instance of.
1116    * @param outer
1117    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
1118    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
1119    * @return A new instance of the class.
1120    */
1121   public final <T> BeanMap<T> newBeanMap(Object outer, Class<T> c) {
1122      BeanMeta m = getBeanMeta(c);
1123      if (m == null)
1124         return null;
1125      T bean = null;
1126      if (m.constructorArgs.length == 0)
1127         bean = newBean(outer, c);
1128      return new BeanMap<>(this, bean, m);
1129   }
1130
1131   /**
1132    * Creates a new empty bean of the specified type, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
1133    * be instantiated within another class instance.
1134    *
1135    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1136    * <p class='bjava'>
1137    *    <jc>// Construct a new instance of the specified bean class</jc>
1138    *    Person <jv>person</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.newBean(Person.<jk>class</jk>);
1139    * </p>
1140    *
1141    * @param <T> The class type of the bean being created.
1142    * @param c The class type of the bean being created.
1143    * @return A new bean object.
1144    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If the specified class is not a valid bean.
1145    */
1146   public final <T> T newBean(Class<T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1147      return newBean(null, c);
1148   }
1149
1150   /**
1151    * Same as {@link #newBean(Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must be instantiated
1152    * within another class instance.
1153    *
1154    * @param <T> The class type of the bean being created.
1155    * @param c The class type of the bean being created.
1156    * @param outer
1157    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
1158    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
1159    * @return A new bean object.
1160    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If the specified class is not a valid bean.
1161    */
1162   public final <T> T newBean(Object outer, Class<T> c) throws BeanRuntimeException {
1163      ClassMeta<T> cm = getClassMeta(c);
1164      BeanMeta m = cm.getBeanMeta();
1165      if (m == null)
1166         return null;
1167      try {
1168         T o = (T)m.newBean(outer);
1169         if (o == null)
1170            throw new BeanRuntimeException(c, "Class does not have a no-arg constructor.");
1171         return o;
1172      } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
1173         throw e;
1174      } catch (Exception e) {
1175         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
1176      }
1177   }
1178
1179   /**
1180    * Returns the {@link BeanMeta} class for the specified class.
1181    *
1182    * @param <T> The class type to get the meta-data on.
1183    * @param c The class to get the meta-data on.
1184    * @return
1185    *    The {@link BeanMeta} for the specified class, or <jk>null</jk> if the class
1186    *    is not a bean per the settings on this context.
1187    */
1188   public final <T> BeanMeta<T> getBeanMeta(Class<T> c) {
1189      if (c == null)
1190         return null;
1191      return getClassMeta(c).getBeanMeta();
1192   }
1193
1194   /**
1195    * Returns a {@code ClassMeta} wrapper around a {@link Class} object.
1196    *
1197    * @param <T> The class type being wrapped.
1198    * @param c The class being wrapped.
1199    * @return The class meta object containing information about the class.
1200    */
1201   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> c) {
1202      return ctx.getClassMeta(c);
1203   }
1204
1205   /**
1206    * Used to resolve <c>ClassMetas</c> of type <c>Collection</c> and <c>Map</c> that have
1207    * <c>ClassMeta</c> values that themselves could be collections or maps.
1208    *
1209    * <p>
1210    * <c>Collection</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or one meta objects indicating the
1211    * element type.
1212    *
1213    * <p>
1214    * <c>Map</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value
1215    * types.
1216    *
1217    * <p>
1218    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
1219    *
1220    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
1221    * <ul>
1222    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A normal type.
1223    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing objects.
1224    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing strings.
1225    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A linked-list containing
1226    *       strings.
1227    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
1228    *       A linked-list containing linked-lists of strings.
1229    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map containing object keys/values.
1230    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map
1231    *       containing string keys/values.
1232    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
1233    *       A map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.
1234    * </ul>
1235    *
1236    * @param <T>
1237    *    The class to resolve.
1238    * @param type
1239    *    The class to resolve.
1240    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
1241    * @param args
1242    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
1243    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
1244    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
1245    * @return The class meta.
1246    */
1247   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
1248      return ctx.getClassMeta(type, args);
1249   }
1250
1251   /**
1252    * Given an array of {@link Type} objects, returns a {@link ClassMeta} representing those arguments.
1253    *
1254    * <p>
1255    * Constructs a new meta on each call.
1256    *
1257    * @param classes The array of classes to get class metas for.
1258    * @return The args {@link ClassMeta} object corresponding to the classes.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1259    */
1260   protected final ClassMeta<Object[]> getArgsClassMeta(Type[] classes) {
1261      Utils.assertArgNotNull("classes", classes);
1262      ClassMeta[] cm = new ClassMeta<?>[classes.length];
1263      for (int i = 0; i < classes.length; i++)
1264         cm[i] = getClassMeta(classes[i]);
1265      return new ClassMeta(cm);
1266   }
1267
1268   /**
1269    * Shortcut for calling {@code getClassMeta(o.getClass())}.
1270    *
1271    * @param <T> The class of the object being passed in.
1272    * @param o The class to find the class type for.
1273    * @return The ClassMeta object, or <jk>null</jk> if {@code o} is <jk>null</jk>.
1274    */
1275   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMetaForObject(T o) {
1276      return (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMetaForObject(o, null);
1277   }
1278
1279   /**
1280    * Shortcut for calling {@code getClassMeta(o.getClass())} but returns a default value if object is <jk>null</jk>.
1281    *
1282    * @param o The class to find the class type for.
1283    * @param def The default {@link ClassMeta} if the object is null.
1284    * @return The ClassMeta object, or the default value if {@code o} is <jk>null</jk>.
1285    */
1286   protected final ClassMeta<?> getClassMetaForObject(Object o, ClassMeta<?> def) {
1287      if (o == null)
1288         return def;
1289      return getClassMeta(o.getClass());
1290   }
1291
1292   /**
1293    * Locale.
1294    *
1295    * <p>
1296    * The locale is determined in the following order:
1297    * <ol>
1298    *    <li><c>locale</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1299    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)} setting on bean context.
1300    *    <li>Locale returned by {@link Locale#getDefault()}.
1301    * </ol>
1302    *
1303    * @see BeanContext.Builder#locale(Locale)
1304    * @return The session locale.
1305    */
1306   public Locale getLocale() {
1307      return locale;
1308   }
1309
1310   /**
1311    * Media type.
1312    *
1313    * <p>
1314    * For example, <js>"application/json"</js>.
1315    *
1316    * @see BeanContext.Builder#mediaType(MediaType)
1317    * @return The media type for this session, or <jk>null</jk> if not specified.
1318    */
1319   public final MediaType getMediaType() {
1320      return mediaType;
1321   }
1322
1323   /**
1324    * Returns the type property name as defined by {@link BeanContext.Builder#typePropertyName(String)}.
1325    *
1326    * @param cm
1327    *    The class meta of the type we're trying to resolve the type name for.
1328    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
1329    * @return The type property name.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1330    */
1331   public final String getBeanTypePropertyName(ClassMeta cm) {
1332      String s = cm == null ? null : cm.getBeanTypePropertyName();
1333      return s == null ? getBeanTypePropertyName() : s;
1334   }
1335
1336   /**
1337    * Returns the name property name.
1338    *
1339    * <p>
1340    * Currently this always returns <js>"_name"</js>.
1341    *
1342    * @return The name property name.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1343    */
1344   public final String getNamePropertyName() {
1345      return "_name";
1346   }
1347
1348   /**
1349    * Returns the bean registry defined in this bean context defined by {@link BeanContext.Builder#beanDictionary(Class...)}.
1350    *
1351    * @return The bean registry defined in this bean context.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1352    */
1353   public final BeanRegistry getBeanRegistry() {
1354      return ctx.getBeanRegistry();
1355   }
1356
1357   /**
1358    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>Object</c>.
1359    *
1360    * <p>
1361    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent "any object type" when an object type is not known.
1362    *
1363    * <p>
1364    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(Object.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1365    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1366    *
1367    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>Object</c> class.
1368    */
1369   public final ClassMeta<Object> object() {
1370      return ctx.object();
1371   }
1372
1373   /**
1374    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>String</c>.
1375    *
1376    * <p>
1377    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent key types in maps.
1378    *
1379    * <p>
1380    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(String.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1381    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1382    *
1383    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>String</c> class.
1384    */
1385   public final ClassMeta<String> string() {
1386      return ctx.string();
1387   }
1388
1389   /**
1390    * Returns a reusable {@link ClassMeta} representation for the class <c>Class</c>.
1391    *
1392    * <p>
1393    * This <c>ClassMeta</c> is often used to represent key types in maps.
1394    *
1395    * <p>
1396    * This method is identical to calling <code>getClassMeta(Class.<jk>class</jk>)</code> but uses a cached copy to
1397    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
1398    *
1399    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>String</c> class.
1400    */
1401   public final ClassMeta<Class> _class() {
1402      return ctx._class();
1403   }
1404
1405   /**
1406    * Creates either an {@link JsonMap} or {@link LinkedHashMap} depending on whether the key type is
1407    * String or something else.
1408    *
1409    * @param mapMeta The metadata of the map to create.
1410    * @return A new map.
1411    */
1412   protected Map newGenericMap(ClassMeta mapMeta) {
1413      ClassMeta<?> k = mapMeta.getKeyType();
1414      return (k == null || k.isString()) ? new JsonMap(this) : map();
1415   }
1416
1417   /**
1418    * Logs a warning message.
1419    *
1420    * @param msg The warning message.
1421    * @param args Optional {@link MessageFormat}-style arguments.
1422    */
1423   @Override
1424   public void addWarning(String msg, Object... args) {
1425      if (isDebug())
1426         LOG.log(Level.WARNING, ()->args.length == 0 ? msg : MessageFormat.format(msg, args));
1427      super.addWarning(msg, args);
1428   }

1502   /**
1503    * Beans require no-arg constructors.
1504    *
1505    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireDefaultConstructor()
1506    * @return
1507    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class must implement a default no-arg constructor to be considered a bean.
1508    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1509    */
1510   public final boolean isBeansRequireDefaultConstructor() {
1511      return ctx.isBeansRequireDefaultConstructor();
1512   }
1513
1514   /**
1515    * Beans require Serializable interface.
1516    *
1517    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireSerializable()
1518    * @return
1519    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class must implement the {@link Serializable} interface to be considered a bean.
1520    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1521    */
1522   public final boolean isBeansRequireSerializable() {
1523      return ctx.isBeansRequireSerializable();
1524   }
1525
1526   /**
1527    * Beans require setters for getters.
1528    *
1529    * @see BeanContext.Builder#beansRequireSettersForGetters()
1530    * @return
1531    *    <jk>true</jk> if only getters that have equivalent setters will be considered as properties on a bean.
1532    *    <br>Otherwise, they are ignored.
1533    */
1534   public final boolean isBeansRequireSettersForGetters() {
1535      return ctx.isBeansRequireSettersForGetters();
1536   }
1537
1538   /**
1539    * Beans require at least one property.
1540    *
1541    * @see BeanContext.Builder#disableBeansRequireSomeProperties()
1542    * @return
1543    *    <jk>true</jk> if a Java class doesn't need to contain at least 1 property to be considered a bean.
1544    *    <br>Otherwise, the bean is serialized as a string using the {@link Object#toString()} method.
1545    */
1546   public final boolean isBeansRequireSomeProperties() {
1547      return ctx.isBeansRequireSomeProperties();
1548   }

1556    */
1557   public final String getBeanTypePropertyName() {

1559   }

1697   /**
1698    * Time zone.
1699    *
1700    * <p>
1701    * The timezone is determined in the following order:
1702    * <ol>
1703    *    <li><c>timeZone</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1704    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)} setting on bean context.
1705    * </ol>
1706    *
1707    * @see BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)
1708    * @return The session timezone, or <jk>null</jk> if timezone not specified.
1709    */
1710   public final TimeZone getTimeZone() {
1711      return timeZone;
1712   }
1713
1714   /**
1715    * Time zone.
1716    *
1717    * <p>
1718    * The timezone is determined in the following order:
1719    * <ol>
1720    *    <li><c>timeZone</c> parameter passed in through constructor.
1721    *    <li>{@link BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)} setting on bean context.
1722    * </ol>
1723    *
1724    * @see BeanContext.Builder#timeZone(TimeZone)
1725    * @return The session timezone, or the system timezone if not specified.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1726    */
1727   public final ZoneId getTimeZoneId() {
1728      return timeZone == null ? ZoneId.systemDefault() : timeZone.toZoneId();
1729   }

1737    */
1738   public final boolean isUseEnumNames() {
1739      return ctx.isUseEnumNames();
1740   }
